title: Scoggie
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Nova Scotia - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Economic conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Nova Scotia - Social conditions
description: While most of Cape Breton's youth leave for the excitement and opportunity of the big cities, twenty-seven-year-old Scoggie Watson remains, clinging to the things he cherishes most: the waters of Lake Bras d'Or, his hand-built sailboat, his freedom, and the friends who stayed behind. This is his story. It is a story that includes the hearty determination of some of the island people, a government scheme to develop marine farming on the Bras d'Or Lakes, and a mysterious stranger who has remained Scoggie's hero since he was fourteen years old. Commentary by Donald Brittain.
